item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.QUICK_SEARCH() method performs the same action as the Quick Filter command. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: With the cursor on the firstname field of the Customer form of AlphaSports, the following script does a quick search using its current value.
section.example: dim ptr as P ptr = form.view("Customer Information") ptr.Quick_Search()

page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.QUICK_SEARCH() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.QUICK_SEARCH() Description The &ltOBJECT>.QUICK_SEARCH() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.QUICK_SEARCH() method performs the same action as the Quick Filter command. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example With the cursor on the firstname field of the Customer form of AlphaSports, the following script does a quick search using its current value. dim ptr as P ptr = form.view("Customer Information") ptr.Quick_Search()
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
